hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Talq ibn Ghannām al-Nakhʿī: I heard Ḥafṣ ibn Ghiyāth say: 'Mālik ibn Migħwul mentioned the virtues of Ṭalḥah (meaning Ṭalḥah ibn Muṣarrif), and a man said to him: Have you seen Ḥuṣayn ibn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān al-Nakhʿī? He said: No. He said: If you had seen him you would not have mentioned Ṭalḥah (meaning from his virtues).' In another version: He said: Ṭalq ibn Ghannām told us, he said: I heard Ḥafṣ ibn Ghiyāth say: 'Ḥuṣayn ibn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān al-Nakhʿī used to wear in winter during the day a padded robe with eighty linings, and his covering at night was [unspecified in text]'

narrators.name: طَلْقُ بْنُ غَنَّامٍ النَّخَعِيُّ
narrators.full_name: Talq ibn Ghannām ibn Zuhayr al-Nakhʿī

narrators.name: حَفْصَ بْنَ غِيَاثٍ
narrators.full_name: Ḥafṣ ibn Ghiyāth ibn Ṭāhir al-ʿAnbarī

Ḥafṣ ibn Ghiyāth is graded as Saduq Yahim (reliable but prone to errors), which slightly weakens the chain
The chain appears to be incomplete - missing intermediate narrators between Ḥafṣ and the original source of the athar

potential_issues.issue: Incomplete isnad chain - fragmentary transmission record with only two explicit narrators
potential_issues.impact: Cannot verify complete chain of transmission from original source; authenticity assessment is compromised

potential_issues.issue: Ḥafṣ ibn Ghiyāth is graded as Saduq Yahim (prone to errors)
potential_issues.impact: While generally acceptable, his reliability issues may introduce slight inaccuracy in the transmission

potential_issues.issue: The athar contains two versions/recensions but lacks clear distinction in the chain
